name: Rice Creek Off-Leash Dog Area
description: The Rice Creek Off-Leash Dog Area in Shoreview, MN is a large, fully-fenced 13-acre dog park with two double-gated entrances and a gated swimming hole. Other features include paths, a prairie, sandy areas and trees. There are restrooms and a water fountain in the Lexington Ave parking lot.

name: Dakota Woods Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to the 16-acre Dakota Woods Dog Park in Rosemount, MN. Pets will find plenty of room to exercise in this massive, fenced dog park featuring lots of wooded trails and double gates for added security. Bring water, and please note that a daily or annual dog pass is required.

name: Battle Creek Dog Park
description: Battle Creek Dog Park is a spacious fully-enclosed 35-acre park for Fido to enjoy in Maplewood, MN. This plentiful space is free to use and visitors do not need a permit. The park has miles of wooded trails & walking paths, plenty of shaded areas and two small ponds where your pet can swim. Allow your companion to swim, explore and play off leash in this beautiful open area. There is no water at this site (except for the ponds) so visitors should also bring a bottle of drinking water.

name: Minneapolis Airport Off-Leash Dog Park
description: Just south of Highway 62, the Minneapolis Airport Off-Leash Dog Park features year-round fun for you and Fido in 80 acres of mixed open space and paths bordering a large swamp/wetland area in Minneapolis, MN. Not all areas are fenced so dogs should have good recall. No permit is required. The land is owned by the Metropolitan Airport Commission and borders the airport runways. Since the park is not managed by the city, no amenities exist here (including trash receptacles). Bring water and waste bags with you, and please take them when you leave.

name: Bloomington Off-Leash Recreation Area
description: The Bloomington Off-Leash Recreation Area in Bloomington, MN is a dog's dream! This 25-acre dog park features a very large grassy area, hills, trees, separate fenced areas and even a pond for those pups that like to swim. A dog license is required to use the park.

name: Albert Lea Community Dog Park at Brookside Park
description: The Albert Lea Community Dog Park is located south of Brookside Boathouse in Brookside Park,  The off-leash dog park is divided into small dog and large dog zones. Facilities/amenities include plenty of shade, water, and parking available. The park is adjacent to a walking trail near Fountain Lake.

name: River Road Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the River Road Dog Park in Rochester, MN. This park includes separate large, fenced dog runs, perfect for pups to socialize and roam off leash. Please remember to pick up after your pup.

name: Higgins Dog Park
description: Higgins Dog Park is a dog park in Fergus Falls, MN. Higgins Dog Park is an off-leash play area where owners can enjoy the park and the chance to socialize with other dog lovers. This park offers two play areas, where dogs are separated by personality types, rather than size. Owners must always carry a leash for their dogs, and spike collars are strictly prohibited; aggressive dogs and females in heat are prohibited from entering the park.

name: Elm Creek Park Reserve Dog Off-Leash Area
description: Fido will find more than enough room to play at the Elm Creek Park Reserve Dog Off-Leash Area in Champlin, MN. This 29-acre, fenced dog park is in the middle of the gorgeous Elm Creek Reserve. The park features a separate area for small dogs and a fenced wetland pond. A daily or annual pass is required. Dogs must be leashed in all areas outside of the off-leash areas.

name: Cleary Lake Dog Off-Leash Area
description: The Cleary Lake Dog Off-Leash Area in Prior Lake, MN is a 28-acre fenced off-leash dog park that is part of the Three Rivers Park District. Take your pet for a run in the lovely prairie setting, which includes a separately fenced pond for dog swimming. A permit from the park district administration is required.

name: Crow-Hassan Dog Off-Leash Area
description: The Crow-Hassan Dog Off-Leash Area in Hanover, MN is a 40-acre unfenced dog park at the Crow-Hassan Park Reserve. There is plenty of space for Fido to run around and blow off steam, but please make sure to stay near and clean up after him. A daily or annual pass is required.

name: Dog Park at Brookdale Park
description: Pets are welcome to run and play off leash at the dog park at Brookdale Park in Brooklyn Park, MN. This fully-fenced dog run features hills and open spaces. An entry fee is required.

name: Indoor Zoomies
description: Indoor Zoomies in Minnetonka, MN is a dog park exclusively for small dogs 30 pounds and under. The play area is fully fenced in and has ramps for your dog to play on. There are also chairs for you to sit at and watch your pup. Fido can join in on the fun once they are registered and upload vet records on the site. They offer a Daily Pass, a 5 Pass Pack, and a 10 Pass Pack.

name: Waggin' Tails Dog Park
description: The Waggin' Tails Dog Park in Benson, MN is an off-leash, fenced-in area that is about two acres in size. This pup recreation area features running fresh water, separate fenced-in areas for small and large dogs, nighttime lighting, seating for humans, a dog pond and community dog toys. The park is sponsored and maintained by the Humane Society of Swift County.

name: Andy's Bark Park
description: Andy's Bark Park is an off-leash dog park in Woodbury, MN. The park has a pet watering station, pet waste disposal stations, mowed walking trails, benches, a sheltered area with picnic tables, and a portable restroom. Be careful as the area is not fully fenced.

name: Anytime Puppy Playground
description: Fido can run and play with his friends at Anytime Puppy Playground in Apple Valley, MN. This 24-hour, membership-based dog park is fully indoors and can be accessed anytime using your phone. Please remember to clean up after your pup and read the park rules online in advance.

name: Dog Park at Bald Eagle-Otter Lakes Regional Park
description: Bring your pet to play off leash at the 10-acre, fully-fenced dog park at Bald Eagle-Otter Lakes Regional Park in White Bear Lake, MN. They offer designated small dog hours from 6:00 PM-7:00 PM on Tuesdays and 10:00 AM-11:00 AM on Saturdays.

name: Plymouth Dog Park
description: The Plymouth Dog Park located in Plymouth, MN is the largest in the city, featuring a drinking fountain, a picnic shelter, a portable restroom, trails and a fenced area for small dogs. The off-leash area is bordered by private property. Please respect the surrounding neighbors and keep your pets within the confines of the dog park.

name: High Bridge Dog Park
description: High Bridge Dog Park, located at the site of a former coal power plant in St. Paul, MN, is a fully-fenced, seven-acre dog park with plenty of space for your pup to romp off leash. The dog park entrance is on the westernmost end of the park, near the parking lot

name: Lake Sarah Dog Off-Leash Area
description: Pets will go wild for the Lake Sarah Dog Off-Leash Area in Rockford, MN. This 30-acre fenced dog park includes trails, grassy spaces and play areas for Fido to run around off leash.

name: Lake Chase Park Dog Park
description: Bring your pet to play off-leash at the dog park at Lake Chase Park in Owatonna, MN, which includes a separate small dog area, walking paths, play pieces for dogs, lights, a fire hydrant, running water and shade.

name: Dog Park at Perry Park
description: Bring Fido to play at the dog park located within Perry Park in Arden Hills, MN. This dog park was converted from an old baseball field into a fenced, off-leash area for Fido to exercise, socialize and play fetch. There is a double gate security system to ensure all dogs stay safe entering and exiting. Make sure to leash Fido back up when returning to the larger Perry Park.

name: Dog Park at Pinecone Central Park
description: Bring Fido to play and exercise at the dog park at Pinecone Central Park in Sartell, MN. This full-fenced area is tucked into the corner of the park, down a gravel trail, with signage at the entrance. Be sure to bring some water for Fido and have proof of their rabies vaccination.

name: Dog Park at Southbridge Community Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the dog park at Southbridge Community Park in Shakopee, MN. This park features a 10-acre all-dog area, a half-acre small dog run, a water station and walking paths. The fee to use the park is included in the City of Shakopee dog license. Please make sure your dog is properly licensed and read all rules and regulations before visiting the park

name: Lake Minnewashta Off-Leash Dog Area
description: The Lake Minnewashta Off-Leash Dog Area in Excelsior, MN, is home to about .8 miles of walking trails, a fenced pond, a separate area for small dogs, two large open spaces for interactive play with other dogs, and a water fountain for humans and pets. Pups must be licensed and vaccinated. Please clean up after your pet.

name: Watertown Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to the Watertown Dog Park, featuring four acres of rolling terrain, tree canopy and small wetlands in Watertown, MN. This park includes completely fenced small and large dog run areas with vestibule entrances, potable water, waste bags and seating areas. This attraction is located adjacent to the Luce Line Trail and Paul Avenue with easy access to downtown and the Crow River.

name: Monti Paws Dog Park
description: Monti Paws Dog Park, located inside Meadow Oak Park, is a dog-friendly recreation area in Monticello, MN. There are two entrances to the park, one on the east side and one on the west side, and both are double-gated to allow for unleashing your pets before entering the park. The small dog area is limited to dogs weighing less than 25 pounds and features a smaller open grassy play area, a bench and a shade tree. The designated space for large dogs welcomes pups of all sizes and features an open grassy play area, watering station, benches, picnic tables and mature shade trees on the east side.

name: Rivertown Dog Park
description: Rivertown Dog Park in Hastings, MN, offers three different areas for Fido to play. Parking and dog waste bags are available. All dogs must be licensed, vaccinated and be wearing up-to-date license tags at all times.

name: Dog Park at Lions Park
description: Bring Fido to run around, socialize and blow off steam at the dog park at Lions Park in Willmar, MN. This 2.5-acre off-leash dog recreation area is completely fenced and includes large and small dog sections, pet waste bags and a trash container. A shelter area and water faucet (seasonal) are also located on site.

name: Buster Park
street: Jenny St and E River Rd
description: Buster Park is a pet-friendly recreation area in Brainerd, MN. This fenced-in dog park is installed at the south end of the Kiwanis Park. The area offers 47,000 square feet for your dog to explore! There are picnic tables, and large trees create plenty of shade to keep you and Fido cool during warmer weather.

name: City of Hutchinson Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to the City of Hutchinson Dog Park to romp off-leash in Hutchinson, MN! The park features a small dog area, a large dog area, grass, benches, a water source, dog waste stations and more. Water is shut off during the winter season. Rules and driving directions can be found on the dog park's official website.

name: Motley Pet Stop & Rec Area
description: Bring Fido to play at the off-leash Motley Pet Stop & Rec Area in Motley, MN. This dog park is located behind the BP station on Main Street and offers a fenced area for your pup to enjoy. There are no trees providing shade, so be sure to bring along plenty of water for Fido.

name: Off-Leash Dog Park at Roosevelt Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the Off-Leash Dog Park within Roosevelt Park in Richfield, MN. This fully fenced-in facility offers separate spaces for small and large breeds. Amenities include grooming stations, accessible picnic tables, lights and a fun pet photo booth.

name: River Oaks Dog Park
description: River Oaks Dog Park is a recreational area in Moorhead, MN. The park features two separate areas for small and large dogs and dog agility equipment. There's also a bench and a picnic table. Dog owners are reminded to bring water for their pets. There are walking paths surrounding the park.

name: Clearwater / Pleasant Regional Park Off-Leash Pet Area
description: Bring Fido to get some exercise at the Clearwater / Pleasant Regional Park Off-Leash Pet Area in Annandale, MN. This pup recreation space features a short trail and an unfenced open grassy area. Please note the pet-friendly area is not gated, so it is reserved for well-behaved pups with good recall. The space can be accessed by parking in the Disc Golf parking lot.

name: Thompson Dog Park
description: Thompson Dog Park in Saint Peter, MN, features two separate areas for large and small dogs to run and play off leash. The park is fully fenced with a double-gated entrance. There are benches, picnic tables, a watering station for pets and a waste removal station.

name: Saint Bark
description: Saint Bark in St. Paul, MN, is an indoor and outdoor dog park where pups can play off-leash while owners relax with local brews, ciders, and seltzers. Enjoy supervised play, big-screen TVs, food trucks and complimentary Wi-Fi in a community-focused space. Entry is per dog; max two dogs per person. Guests must be 18+ for safety.

name: Dog Park at Staring Lake Park
description: Visit the dog park at Staring Lake Park, a 5.7-acre off-leash area in Eden Prairie, MN. The park features include grassy open areas, natural walking paths and lovely wooded trails. This park closes after the first sufficient snow fall of the year to utilize the area as a Nordic ski trail, and is only open mid-March to December.

name: Fish Lake Regional Park Dog Off-Leash Area
description: Dogs can run and play in the seven-acre haven at the Fish Lake Regional Park Dog Off-Leash Area in Maple Grove, MN, which features a walking area as well as a smaller running area for small breeds.

name: Jean & Carl Frank Canine Park
description: The Jean & Carl Frank Canine Park in Rochester, MN is a large open space for dogs to play off leash. The park is equipped with a variety of agility equipment, including tunnels, bridges and more. Humans can watch from benches provided under the shade of trees. Be careful as sections of the park are not fully fenced. These sections lead to paved walking trails that you can also explore with your pooch. Dog owners are reminded to clean up any mess left behind.

name: Jean Duluth Dog Park
description: Jean Duluth Dog Park is a 3.5-acre fenced park at the northern edge of Duluth, MN. It has a double-gated entry and a separate area for dogs up to 20 pounds.

name: Hibbing Dog Park
description: Pets will love to play off leash at the Hibbing Dog Park in Hibbing, MN. This fully fenced dog park includes a separate area for smaller pets.

name: Dog Park at Homeward Hills Park
description: Pets are welcome to run and play off leash at the dog park at Homeward Hills Park in Eden Prairie, MN. This fenced recreation area is open seasonally, from April-October, as it is used as a hockey rink during the winter months.

name: Minnehaha Off-Leash Dog Park
description: The Minnehaha Off-Leash Dog Park in Minneapolis, MN spans more than six acres and features a doggy beach to let your pup roam, socialize, splash and play. An off-leash permit is required to gain admittance. Pups must be leashed at all times when not in the designated off-leash area. Please note that the park is partially fenced.

name: Fairmont Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the Fairmont Dog Park, located adjacent to the walk/bike/run trail system and the Aquatic Park in Fairmount, MN. This 1.5-acre off-leash pup recreation area has a double-gated entryway with separate areas for small and large dogs. Dog owners are reminded to clean up any less that is left behind.

name: Gary Mattson Dog Park
description: Gary Mattson Dog Park in Buffalo, MN, features a large off-leash fenced area where Fido can romp and play. There is a covered shelter with a picnic table where pet parents can rest. Leashed dogs can cool off in the water at Buffalo Lake, which is mere steps from the dog park.

name: Hackensack Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to Hackensack Dog Park in Hackensack, MN. This fenced, off-leash dog park is located within Bonna Park, and provides pups a safe place to run and play. The dog park has a water source for dogs to stay hydrated as they romp with their friends. Please note that dogs must be leashed until they reach the dog park.

name: Eveleth Dog Park
description: Fido can enjoy time off-leash at Eveleth Dog Park in Eveleth, MN. This fenced dog park features trees, shade, big rocks, benches and waste receptacles. Please note that a permit and fee are required to utilize this dog park.

name: Breckenridge Dog Park
description: Breckenridge Dog Park is a great place to let Fido play off leash. The park features a 6-foot fence with double gates and includes a small and large dog area, doggy waste station, seating, and a bike rack. Dog owners are reminded to clean up any mess that is left behind in the park. Breckenridge Dog Park is open every day of the week from dawn until dusk.

name: Dog Park at Pomme De Terre
description: Fido is invited to play at the dog park at Pomme De Terre in Morris, MN. The off-leash facility features two separate sections for large and small dogs. Amenities include agility equipment, water buckets and tennis balls, which visitors provide.

name: Jackson Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the Jackson Dog Park located in Jackson, MN. This off-leash area features two designated sections with a water fountain for you and your pup, as well as agility equipment. Shade and seating opportunities are available.

name: Carver Park Reserve Dog Off-Leash Area
description: Carver Park Reserve Dog Off-Leash Area is a 27-acre, completely fenced dog park with a separate area for small dogs. There is no water supply, so bring drinking water for your dog and yourself. A daily or annual pass is required. Don't forget to clean up any mess that is left behind and to keep your pup under control at all times

name: Savage Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the Savage Dog Park, which consists of more than two acres of fenced-off open space in Savage, MN. It includes separate areas for small and large dogs, four mailboxes that contain poop bags, running water during warm weather and dog toys.

name: Bryant Lake Dog Off-Leash Area
description: Dogs go wild for the nine-acre, fully-fenced Bryant Lake Dog Off-Leash Area in Eden Prairie, MN. The site features a double-gated entry and includes an area for small dogs. Shelter and water are available. A daily or annual pass is required.

name: Arlington Arkwright Dog Park
description: Nestled in a residential neighborhood in St. Paul MN, the Arlington Arkwright Dog Park is a 4.5-acre park offering people and pets an opportunity to engage in social interaction and play. Dogs can be off leash in this fully-fenced area, and there are wooded trails and plenty of open space to run.

name: Dog Park at Kiwanis Recreation Area
description: Visit the two large, fenced-in dog parks at the Kiwanis Recreation Area in Mankato, MN. Pups are free to play and run off leash at this park featuring tons of grass and trees. Poop bags are also provided.

name: Lowertown Dog Park
description: The Lowertown Dog Park in St. Paul, MN is a completely fenced-in area located near CHS Field. Dogs are welcome to run around off leash. Please note all pups must be licensed and vaccinated. Make sure to clean up after your pet.

name: Stewartville Dog Park
description: Stewartville Dog Park is a dog-friendly recreation area in Stewartville, Minnesota. The fenced-in area is a great place for dogs to socialize and play. Dog owners must have a leash with them at all times while hanging out at the park.

name: Ritter Farm Dog Park
description: Ritter Farm Dog Park is a dog-friendly greenspace in Lakeville, MN. The heavily forested park is near a lake and offers a large fenced run with water fountains for pups and people. There are 18 parking spots and a portable restroom on site.

name: Nymore Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to play at the Nymore Dog Park in Bemidji, MN. This fenced dog park is separated into two sections, one for small dogs and one for large dogs, to ensure that all pups have a fun, safe visit. Remember to leash Fido back up when exiting the park.

name: Dog Park
description: Dog Park is an off-leash recreation area in Cambridge, MN with tons of open space and ample shade. Dogs must be on a leash until safely within the confines of the park. Owners must keep leashes with them at all times and have voice-control over their pets. Please make sure to pick up after your pup.

name: Dog Park at Bassett Creek Park
description: Dogs are welcome to run and play off leash at the dog park at Bassett Creek Park in Crystal, MN. The area is grass covered with tall, shady trees and includes separate spaces for large and small dogs. Please make sure your pup is leashed at all times when not in the dog park.

name: Loring Park Off-Leash Dog Park
description: City dogs will love the chance to play and run off leash at the Loring Park Off-Leash Dog Park in Minneapolis, MN. The designated area is in the northeast section of this public park, which includes grass, boulders, a bridge, gravel and trees. A permit is required.

name: Victory Prairie Off-Leash Dog Park
description: Visit the Victory Prairie Off-Leash Dog Park in Minneapolis, MN. This pup recreation area features 2.5 acres, all fenced in, mostly grass, with a few gravel paths and wood chips by the picnic tables. Water is not provided, so make sure to bring enough for you and Fido. The entrance to this park is ADA-compliant.

name: St. Anthony Parkway Off-Leash Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the St. Anthony Parkway Off-Leash Dog Park in Minneapolis, MN. This 2-acre, completely fenced off-leash park includes mulch ground cover and shade trees. Remember to bring water. A daily or annual permit is required.

name: Kaposia Landing Dog Park
description: Your pet will love to run off leash at the 6.3-acre fully-fenced, grassy Kaposia Landing Dog Park in South St. Paul, MN, which includes picnic tables and shade areas. There is also seasonal running water on site. Membership from the city is required.

name: Two Harbors Dog Park
description: Two Harbors Dog Park is a public dog area for you and your pup to socialize and exercise safely off leash in Two Harbors, MN. This dog park is open seasonally from June-November and is located in the practice rink behind Lake County Arena.

name: Lyndale Farmstead Off-Leash Dog Park
description: Lyndale Farmstead Off-Leash Dog Park is one of seven dog-friendly recreation areas in the Minneapolis, MN area. There are benches and shaded areas for humans to enjoy while pets run around the park. Please note that the ground at this dog area is crushed granite, and some pup's paws may be sensitive to this surface. A daily or annual permit is required.

name: Susan E. Lurton Nature Park and Off Leash Dog Park
description: Susan E. Lurton Nature Park and Off Leash Dog Park is a 39-acre park located on the southwestern shore of Lake Classen in Long Lake, MN. The park offers trails for walking Fido, benches and parking. Please note that an annual pass is required.

name: WAG Farms Dog Park
description: WAG Farms Dog Park is a pet-friendly volunteer-run dog park in Cottage Grove, MN featuring grasslands, wooded areas and a pond. There's a special area just for small dogs, too. Throughout the 14 acres, thereâ€™s space for a game of fetch and a general wander together.

name: Lauderdale Dog Park
description: Lauderdale Dog Park is a small fenced-in dog park located in the northeast corner of the Community Park in Lauderdale, MN. Dogs are welcome to play with their friends and get some exercise in this park.

name: Pooch Playland Dog Park
description: Fido will love to explore and romp at Pooch Playland Dog Park in Alexandria, MN. This secluded park overlooks Lake Connie and has two fenced areas. Vibrant green grass makes the perfect stomping ground for pups who like to make friends and play fetch! Dog owners are reminded to clean up any mess that dogs leave behind.

name: Prairie Island Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the Prairie Island Dog Park in Winona, MN. This off-leash dog park is home to an area for smaller and less active dogs, as well as a fairly big area for bigger and more active dogs. There are some trees that will provide a nice shade for dogs, too.

name: Hackensack Dog Park
description: Hackensack Dog Park in Hackensack, MN, welcomes Fido to join you on just under an acre of fenced-in land. Your pup can enjoy some exercise and socialization with other four-legged visitors. Park amenities include benches and a water source where you can fill up Fido's bowl.

name: Dog Park at Jessens Park
description: The dog park at Jessens Park welcomes Fido to enjoy some off-leash exercise and fresh air in St. Charles, MN. Partnering with the St. Charles Lions, this city park provides a fenced area for visiting canines to explore and socialize with one another along with a shaded bench for pet parents.

name: Indoor Zoomies
description: Bring Fido for some fun at Indoor Zoomies in Minnetonka, MN. This indoor dog park is exclusive for small dogs under 30 pounds. This indoor space does require an entrance fee, and both daily passes and pass packs are available.

name: Woodview Off-Leash Dog Park
description: The Woodview Off-Leash Dog Park in Roseville, MN, is a cooperative project between the City of Roseville and Ramsey County. Dogs without a leash can exercise in two soft trail areas. Both spaces are fully fenced, making them perfect areas for off-leash play.

name: Lake of the Isles Off-Leash Dog Park
street: 2845 W Lake of the Isles Pkwy
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the Lake of the Isles Off-Leash Dog Park in Minneapolis, MN. This 1.87-acre completely fenced dog area features a separate space for small dogs, so everyone can play safely. Please make sure to pick up after your pet and read all rules and regulations before arriving.

name: Dog Park at Bunker Hills Regional Park
description: Bring Fido to the dog park at Bunker Hills Regional Park in Andover, MN. This 6.5-acre park has a small and large dog run, an open play area and a short trail for those that want to walk with their dog. This park is free to use. Remember to bring water for your pup.

name: Swanson Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to run around and socialize at the Swanson Dog Park in Blaine, MN. This fenced dog recreation area features separate large and small dog runs, shelters with heaters and power, picnic tables, clean bag containers, drinking fountains and a security light.

name: Love's Travel Stop
description: Love's Travel Stop in Rockville, MN is a dog-friendly gas station and rest area. Across America, you'll find Love's Travel Stops that offer facilities for traveling canines. This location has a fully-fenced dog park with a convenient waste station.

name: Loyalty Dog Park
description: The Loyalty Dog Park is an enclosed, off-leash canine, exercise area located in Marshall, MN. It's owned and operated by the City of Marshall. Some of the amenities at the Marshall Area Dog Run include a double-gated entrance, designated areas for large and small breed dogs, watering stations, benches, tables, fire hydrants and shaded areas.

name: Brew Park
description: Brew Park is a unique attraction in Plymouth, MN, featuring an indoor dog park and restaurant. Canine companions can access the membership-only turfed park area to enjoy off-leash fun. The enclosed space features park rangers and a separate area for small pups. Visitors can also treat themselves to a bite from The Barkery, where Fido can chow down on a snack from the dog menu, like pumpkin bones or a doggy brew. Owners can enjoy options such as BBQ pork sliders, pickle chicken flatbread, or a BLT caprese baguette with beer, wine, or seltzer.

name: Cannon Falls Dog Park
description: Fido is welcome to play at Cannon Falls Dog Park in Cannon Falls, MN. The off-leash area offers a fully fenced, grassy space for small and large dogs, as well as two play tunnels. Upon arriving, you'll notice the dog park is located next to the baseball fields.

name: Alimagnet Dog Park
description: Alimagnet Dog Park is the perfect place to let your dog run free in Burnsville, MN. It features a seven-acre off-leash fenced area, a double-gated entry, a pond, an open grass area, a wood-mulch walking path, a wooded area, picnic tables, benches, waste bags and trash containers. Park rules include picking up after your dog and filling any holes that your dog may dig. All dogs must enter and exit the park on a leash. Any aggressive behavior will not be tolerated.

name: Keene Creek Dog Park
description: Pets will love to run and play off leash at the Keene Creek Dog Park in Duluth, MN. This fully-fenced dog park features a separate area for dogs under 20 pounds and running water in the warmer months.

name: Wilson Park Off Leash Pet Exercise Area
description: Bring Fido to run and play at the Wilson Park Off Leash Pet Exercise Area, located in St Cloud, MN. The dog park area is at the south end of the park and is surrounded by chain link fencing on three sides, with the fourth side open to river access. Visitors are required to have an Off-Leash Pet Exercise Areas (OLPEA) permit.

name: Whitney Dog Park
description: Your pup will love to run and make friends at Whitney Dog Park in St Cloud, MN. This fenced, off-leash park requires an Off-Leash Pet Exercise Areas (OLPEA) permit. Fido will love the fresh air and view of the Sauk River.

name: Flying Cloud Drive Dog Park
description: Pets will love to romp and play off leash at the Flying Cloud Drive Dog Park in Eden Prairie, MN. This fenced dog park, which is open year-round, includes a section for small or fragile dogs, in addition to a larger area for big dogs.

name: Jaycees Dog Park
description: Fido will love to run and make friends at the off-leash Jaycees Dog Park in St Cloud, MN. This fenced park has trees to provide shad and picnic tables. An Off-Leash Pet Exercise Areas (OLPEA) permit is needed to bring your pup to this specially-designated area.

name: Dog Park at Cedar Knoll Park
description: Pets love to play off leash at the dog park at Cedar Knoll Park in St. Louis Park, MN. This fenced dog area includes lovely trees for shade. A permit from the city is required.

name: Dog Park at Dakota Park
description: Pets will love to play off leash at the dog park at Dakota Park in St. Louis Park, MN. This fenced dog park includes a separate area for smaller pups. Permits are available from the city inspections desk.

name: Franklin Terrace Off-Leash Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to explore the Franklin Terrace Off-Leash Dog Park in Minneapolis, MN. This dog park is completely fenced, so pups can feel free to run around, socialize and blow off steam. Please remember to pick up after your pet.

name: Dog Park at Edenvale Park
description: Pets are welcome to run and play off leash at the dog park at Edenvale Park in Eden Prairie, MN. This fenced recreation area is open seasonally, from April-October, as it is used as a hockey rink during the winter months.

name: Dog Park at Thresher Fields Park
description: The dog park at Thresher Fields Park in Eagan, MN features trails, rolling hills and open spaces. The entire area is fenced, including the lake shore with gated access to the lake. Additionally, there's a designated, fenced area for small dogs. Permits are required for dogs visiting this park.

name: Dog Park at Holbrook Park
description: Visit the dog park at Holbrook Park, an off-leash dog area in Long Lake, MN. All pups that use the park must be current on licensing with their city of residence and on vaccinations. Rules for use are posted near the entrance to the off-leash area. The park is open seasonally April-October, as it is used as a hockey rink during the winter months.

name: Fancy Coats Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to the Fancy Coats Dog Park in Willmar, MN. This spacious fenced park is located behind Fancy Coats Pet Grooming & Inn, and features lots or trees, benches and running water. Park use costs $3. Pay inside Fancy Coats or in the white box inside the dog park entrance.

name: Dog Park at Crestwood Park
description: Pets are welcome to run and play off leash at the dog park at Crestwood Park in Eden Prairie, MN. This fenced recreation area is open seasonally, from April-October, as it is used as a hockey rink during the winter months.

name: Dog Park at Welcome Park
description: Pets are welcome to play off leash at the dog park at Welcome Park in Crystal, MN. This completely fenced dog area is open seasonally, as it serves as a hockey rink in winter.

name: Van Valkenburg Park Off-Leash Dog Area
description: Bring Fido to explore the Van Valkenburg Park Off-Leash Dog Area in Edina, MN. This fenced dog park includes amenities such as restrooms and benches. Dogs using the park must wear a special green collar that identifies them as a leash-free permit holder by contacting Edina City Hall.

name: North Loop Dog Park
description: Visit the North Loop Dog Park, an approximately 6,000 square feet area solely dedicated for off-leash play by neighborhood dogs in Minneapolis, MN.

name: Sochacki Park Dog Off-Leash Area
description: Bring Fido to blow off steam at the Sochacki Park Dog Off-Leash Area in Minneapolis, MN. This 1-acre fenced dog park has a separate area for small dogs. Remember to bring water for you and your pup. Dogs must be leashed at all times when not in the dog park.

name: Alpine Dog Park
description: Alpine Dog Park is a pet-friendly recreation area in Ramsey, MN. The designated off-leash area is located in the center of Alpine Park beyond ball fields Number 2 and Number 3. This site is partially irrigated, with about half of the several acres with tall grass and a wooded corner. The park is also equipped with a pet fountain and seating for humans.

name: Bark Park at Sunnybrook Park
description: Bring Fido to play at the Bark Park located within Sunnybrook Park in Wadena, MN. This fenced-in area allows your pup plenty of space to run and explore off his leash! Water fountains and trash cans are available. Remember to leash Fido back up before exiting into the larger park.

name: Otsego Dog Park
description: Otsego Dog Park is pet-friendly. Located in the southeast corner of Otsego Prairie Park, this fenced space is home to many oak and maple trees for shade, picnic tables, lights, and portable potties can be accessed all year around. Water is available to dogs during the summer months. Otsego Dog Park is open every day of the week from sunrise to 10pm.

name: DL Dog Park
description: DL Dog Park is a dog-friendly park in Detroit Lakes, MN, that is open seven days a week from sunrise to sunset. The large fenced park features dirt and grass play areas, a small pavilion with picnic tables, a dog water fountain, and a dog waste station.

name: Gateway Dog Park
description: Visit the Gateway Dog Park in Minneapolis, MN, where your pup can enjoy the agility equipment in the fenced-off area. Please remember to clean up after Fido.

name: Brooklyn Park Environmental Nature Area
description: The Brooklyn Park Environmental Nature Area is an off-leash dog park in Brooklyn Park, MN. This dog area features big grassy spaces and is completely fenced in. The fee for entry into the park is $3 per day and $10 annually.

name: Love's Travel Stop
description: Love's Travel Stop in St. Charles, MN, is a dog-friendly gas station and rest area. Across America, you'll find Love's Travel Stops that offer facilities for traveling canines. This location has a fully-fenced dog park with a convenient waste station.

name: Lions Park Off-Leash Dog Areas
description: The Lions Park Off-Leash Dog Areas in Chaska, MN are two separate dog parks featuring a smaller area with cut grass for throwing the ball or just relaxing at a picnic table, and an exotic and dry wooded nature area for you and your canine friend to explore! The small, fenced-in area has a drinking station, wash station and concrete entrance pad. The wooded fenced-in area contains 4.26 acres and is located across the creek from the small fenced-in area.

name: Love's Travel Stop Columbus
description: Love's Travel Stop in Columbus, MN, is a pet-friendly gas station and rest area. Traveling canines will enjoy stretching their legs at this fenced dog park, which features plenty of grass, benches, trash receptacles and waste bags.

name: Love's Travel Stop Columbus
description: Love's Travel Stop is a gas station and rest area in Columbus, MN. This pet-friendly location has a fully-fenced dog park with separate areas for small and large pups and trash receptacles. Features of this pit stop also include Hardee's, Godfather's Pizza, private showers, a laundry facility, Wi-Fi, truck parking and more.

name: Dog Park at South German Park
description: Bring Fido to the dog park at South German Park in New Ulm, MN. This off-leash dog park features two fenced-in areas for small and large dogs to play, run around and socialize safely. Dog owners are reminded to clean up any mess left behind.

name: Dog Park at Riebe Park
description: The dog park at Riebe Park in Princeton, MN contains a large fenced-in area for dogs to run around off leash and picnic tables for the owners. There is also a water fountain for pups to rehydrate before their next round of fetch.

name: Centennial Dog Park
description: Centennial Dog Park is a recreational space in Moorhead, MN. The park features three separate fenced areas, agility equipment, picnic tables and benches. There's plenty of space for Fido to get some exercise and meet new friends. Dog owners are reminded to bring water for their pets.

name: Saint Peter Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Saint Peter Dog Park in Minnesota. The park features two separate areas for large and small dogs and double-gated entrances. Picnic tables, benches, and a trash can are available, but please pack your own waste bags and water.

name: Dog Park at UÅ‹ÄÃ­ MakhÃ¡ Park
description: Bring Fido to socialize and exercise off leash at the dog park at UÅ‹ÄÃ­ MakhÃ¡ Park in St. Paul, MN. This fully fenced, multi-surface recreation space features a range of amenities, including waste stations, water fountains, shaded seating and double-gated entry. Canine companions must be leashed when entering and exiting the dog park.

name: Grand Marais Dog Park
description: Explore the scenic trails of Cook County in Minnesota with your well-behaved pup, as the Grand Marais Dog Park, managed by Go Dog North Shore, invites your furry friend to play. Be aware that the terrain may feature uneven surfaces with rocks and roots. Upon arrival, you'll discover a spacious 3-acre fenced area and a designated section for small dogs weighing under 25 pounds.

name: Wabasha Dog Park
description: Wabasha Dog Park is an off-leash area in Wabasha, MN, where Fido is invited to play and socialize with other pups. This fenced area offers a great space for your pup to exercise while you enjoy some fresh air. Park amenities include a picnic table and shade trees.

name: Dog Park at Winter Park
description: Bring Fido to exercise and socialize off leash at the dog park at Winter Park in Albertville, MN. This small, public recreation space features a fenced park where four-legged friends can romp and sniff together. Dogs must be leashed when entering and exiting the park.

name: Sandstone Dog Park
description: Sandstone Dog Park in Sandstone, MN welcomes Fido to enjoy some exercise and fresh air at this fenced park that offers a large area of grass and dirt to explore. Dogs must be leashed when entering/exiting the park and be cleaned up after. Puppies under four months aren't permitted, and children under 13 must be accompanied by an adult.

name: Hayward Rest Area
description: Hayward Rest Area in Albert Lea, MN is a dog-friendly stop along I-90 that features a fenced off-leash dog park. Though it's a small, single-area space, it's grassy, clean and perfect for letting pups stretch their legs. The rest area also includes restrooms, a picnic area, a playground and access to walking trails. Conveniently located near mile marker 162 on eastbound I-90.

name: Lake City Dog Park
description: Four-legged friends are invited to socialize and explore at Lake City Dog Park in Lake City, MN. This fenced recreation area features a separate small-dog area so pups of all sizes can enjoy off-leash play. Amenities include double-gated entry, shaded picnic tables, waste bags and trash receptacles.

name: City of Northfield Dog Park
description: Bring your pet to play off-leash at the simple, fenced, City of Northfield Dog Park in Northfield, MN, which includes a shelter, benches and picnic tables.

name: Dog Park at Orono Park
description: Visit the dog park at Orono Park, a beautiful off-leash lakeside area in Elk River, MN featuring tons of room to run, a picnic table and a doggy fountain.

name: Meeker Island Dog Park
description: The Meeker Island Dog Park in St. Paul, MN features a large dog run and dog beach. There is no fence surrounding the park, which is bordered by the Mississippi River and the steep river bluffs. Dogs that are under control are allowed to run off leash as long their owners are in sight at all times.

name: Dog Park at Locke Park
description: Your pet will thank you for a chance to play off-leash at the dog park at Locke Park in Fridley, MN. This fenced dog run features mulched ground cover, picnic tables and lovely wooded areas. Bring water with you. A daily or annual permit is required.

name: Observation Dog Park
description: Dogs can run off leash at the Observation Dog Park in Duluth, MN. This fully-fenced dog park includes a separate area for dogs under 20 pounds. Owners must bring their own water. Parking is located where 10th Ave ends.

name: Stillwater Dog Park
description: The Stillwater Dog Park is a fenced, off-leash dog park in Stillwater, MN. The park was established in 2014 to promote responsible dog ownership through community-based recreation and education. Licenses are required for use.

name: Dog Park at Valley Place Park
description: Pets are welcome to play off leash at the dog park at Valley Place Park in Crystal, MN. This fenced dog area is open seasonally, as it sometimes serves as a hockey rink in winter.

name: Dog Park at Nesbitt Preserve Park
description: Pets are welcome to run and play off leash at the dog park at Nesbitt Preserve Park in Eden Prairie, MN. This fenced recreation area is open seasonally, from April-October, as it is used as a hockey rink during the winter months.
